text: She sells seashells by the seashore.
ipa: ʃi sɛlz siʃɛlz baɪ ðə siʃɔr

text: Peter Piper picked a peck of pickled peppers.
ipa: ˈpiːtər ˈpaɪpər pɪkt ə pɛk əv ˈpɪkəld ˈpɛpərz

text: How can a clam cram in a clean cream can?
ipa: haʊ kæn ə klæm kræm ɪn ə klin krim kæn

text: Six sleek swans swam swiftly southwards.
ipa: sɪks sliːk swɑnz swæm ˈswɪftli ˈsaʊθwərdz

twister: How much wood would a woodchuck chuck if a woodchuck could chuck wood?
ipa: haw mʌt͡ʃ wʊd wʊd ə wʊdt͡ʃʌk t͡ʃʌk ɪf ə wʊdt͡ʃʌk kʊd t͡ʃʌk wʊd?

twister: Pablito clavó un clavito en la calva de un calvito.
ipa: pæblitow klævó ʌn klævitow ɛn lɑ kælvə di ʌn kælvitow.
